item.title: Bad Machinery for December 27th 2012
item.description:
Got a new e-reader? 1/3 off all ebook orders from my shop (over £2) with code BOXXO - expires 5PM GMT today (Dec 27th). See all my ebooks here, take your pick! 

Albums of the year pt 4, 8-5. Shauna and Charlotte discuss beach parties, America Town, boffins and dirty babies.



Ads by Project Wonderful! Your ad here, right now: $0

item.title: Bad Machinery for October 22nd 2012
item.description:
NEW BOOK

Whether you want to delight an ally this festive season or just get something 100% FANTASTIC for yourself, I'll be adding lots of new things to my shop and the Topatoco store over the coming weeks.

First up is my new book, THAT, collecting Shelley Winters' recent adventure in America. This large-format 36-page (A4) book features four new pages of story and many subtle revisions. And it's the crispest, prettiest-looking book I've ever made. If you want, you can get it in a money-saving combo-pack with my Murder She Writes and Giant Days books - three standalone stories ideal for converting non-believers to our superior way of thinking!

item.title: Bad Machinery for October 2nd 2012
item.description:
'Jerusalem' is a hymn, the Women's Institute aren't trying to mess around in the Middle East. At least not to my knowledge. I'm fairly sure that a. they aren't involved in gerrymandering either and b. Linton doesn't know what gerrymandering actually is.



Ads by Project Wonderful! Your ad here, right now: $0

item.description:

item.title: Bad Machinery for September 20th 2012
item.description: Parents aren't meant to have favourites, but I think Linton is definitely his dad's favourite. What's nicer than a father and son sharing crime statistics?

item.title: Bad Machinery for September 17th 2012
item.description: Poor old Mike. He's been run ragged by working with successive Winters sisters - the ragged unprofessionalism of Shelley and the steel-eyed focus of Erin have left him looking very tired. Mike's finest hour was the agricultural nightmare of the Great Tackleford Show.

item.title: Bad Machinery for September 14th 2012
item.description:
:: After sitting out the last story, Erin Winters returns with her appalling car. I can believe in any number of supernatural beasts in these stories but believing that "Phyllis" can pass her MOT just pushes things a bit too far. I know people aren't fools.



Ads by Project Wonderful! Your ad here, right now: $0

item.title: Bad Machinery for September 13th 2012
item.description:
A moment with the ruffian element. Some international readers won't know what a PCSO is, although I suppose you can probably guess. They are like police officers, but they just patrol neighbourhoods on foot looking for minor miscreants, they never jump over the hood of a car or drive through a big pile of cardboard boxes in an alleyway. It stands for "Police Community Support Officer".



Ads by Project Wonderful! Your ad here, right now: $0

item.title: Bad Machinery for September 7th 2012
item.description:
Newer readers may not recall Charlotte's early appearances in Scary Go Round with her sister Sarah. Here's ground zero of the Grote revolution.

RETRIBUTION AT LAST
I've added the well out-of-print fourth Scary Go Round collection 'The Retribution Index' to my eBook store, where you can buy it now! Use code EPRO at checkout to get 15% off all my ebooks until Monday 10th.

item.title: Bad Machinery for September 6th 2012
